titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Obstetrical Society of Philadelphia was organized in Philadelphia on 6 June 1868 at the instigation of Albert Holmes Smith. Its objects were to advance the study of obstetrics and the diseases of women and children through case presentations, discussions, and publication. The society was incorporated on 14 April 1877. The officers of the society are a president, president-elect, immediate past president, vice-president, secretary, assistant secretary, and treasurer. The business affairs of the society are administered by its Council, composed of the officers and four other members. There are, currently, five categories of membership: active, associate, life, honorary, and inactive. There was also, historically, another category, corresponding membership, for physicians outside the Delaware Valley but within the United States.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Obstetrical Society of Philadelphia. Materials include: minutes (1988, 1992-2000): correspondence; financial records; programs; newsletters; membership lists; constitution and by-laws; Society stationery; and negatives of meetings and speakers. Materials related to the Society's review courses, include: course books: registration and Continuing Medical Education credit information; evaluations; and course slides. Many of the records come from the files of Eleanor Slanga, Executive Secretary of the Society. The collection also includes Committee for the Study of Pelvic Cancer patient surveys, 1951-1956.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: College of Physicians of Philadelphia: Obstetrical Society of Philadelphia records (MSS 3/0008-01).
